summary:
Post-editing is used to identify and correct errors in MT output. 

Post-editing is used only to identify errors in MT output. 

Post-editing is used to re-translate poor quality MT segments.

The term 'post-editor' has become somewhat outdated, since new translator tools allow linguists to work on various types of tasks in one interface.

The term post-editor has become somewhat outdated, since MT technology has become more reliable. 

The term post-editor has become somewhat outdated, since new translator tools have allowed the automation of post-editing.

Output from a MT system can contain multiple types of errors.

Output from a MT system usually contains only grammatical or terminology errors. 

Output from a MT system usually contains very few errors.

Errors produced by a MT system can depend on language pair and direction, content type, training data, or training techniques.

Errors produced by a MT system can depend on target language, content type, training data, or training techniques.

Errors produced by a MT system are very rare and can depend on the mood of the translator.
